title: Novel immune syndrome described
summary: Researchers have discovered a new human immunodeficiency syndrome in two patients on separate continents. The study reveals that a mutation in a gene called IKBKB disrupts the immune system, leading to excessive inflammation and the loss of both T and B white blood cells.

summary_detail.value: Researchers have discovered a new human immunodeficiency syndrome in two patients on separate continents. The study reveals that a mutation in a gene called IKBKB disrupts the immune system, leading to excessive inflammation and the loss of both T and B white blood cells.
